streak.title: Day Streak
options: One giant leap for you, one small step for the planet.
You'll always meet twice in life – hopefully more often here.
You're unstoppable – like an e-bike with tailwind.
With you, even the CO₂ footprint retires.
Three weeks already? You're like seasonal leek: underrated but valuable.
You're so green, even photosynthesis asks you for tips.
Hotter than my compost in summer!
If you get any cooler, you'll solve global warming on your own!
We didn’t think anyone would get this far. But here you are.
We're still working on a trophy.
If you keep going this strong, we'll need a new roof – solar-powered, of course.
The climate conference is calling – they want you as keynote speaker.
We tried to come up with a line, but you left us speechless.

fbs.FBW: The Business department submitted the most data today.

sr_statistic.value: Number of entries by the department

record: Here you can see your records
You've set a new record. Three days in a row – keep it up!
You've set a new record. One week of consistent entries – stay on it!
You've set a new record. Two weeks of consistent entries – respect!
You've set a new record. Three weeks of consistent entries – impressive!
You've set a new record. One month of consistent entries – nothing can stop you!
You're so AMAZING we ran out of medals for you...

notificationForm.legendDays: Select the weekdays you're at the university so you only receive reminders when they’re relevant to you.
notificationForm.title: Notifications
notificationForm.description: When would you like to receive push notifications?

login.title: Login
login.description: Welcome back! Sign in with your email and password to continue.
login.sr_description: Please enter email and password to log in.

general.projectSlogan: The sustainability app of </br> Brandenburg University of Applied Sciences
general.logo_sr: Logo of the SustainAble app: A leaf with a curved S in the center
general.notImplementet: This feature is not yet implemented

line.title: CO₂ Emissions of THB This Year (in t)
line.sr_description: This statistic shows a line chart of CO₂ emissions over the months from February to June. It started at 5 tons at the beginning of the year and steadily increased with a slight dip in April.
line.altText: Line chart showing CO₂ emissions from February to June this year.

cloud.sr_description: This visualization shows the CO₂ emissions in kilograms of the three departments as colored clouds. Each department is represented by a cloud in its faculty color. The size of the cloud corresponds to the amount of emissions: the bigger the cloud, the higher the emissions. The exact value is shown in the center of each cloud.
cloud.title: CO₂ Emissions: Faculty Comparison in kg
cloud.altText: CO₂ emissions of the three departments as differently sized colored clouds with values in kilograms in the center.

bar.title: Distances Reported by Faculty Students to THB (Last 5 Days)
bar.sr_description: This bar chart shows the total distances traveled by the three departments over five days. Each day displays three bars – one for each department. The taller the bar, the more kilometers were traveled on that day by that department.

iconArival.title: Today's Choice of Transport to THB
iconArival.sr_description: This visual statistic shows the number of transportation modes used to reach the university. Instead of bars, icons such as a car, bicycle, or walking person are shown in different sizes. The bigger the icon, the more frequently that mode was used.
iconArival.altText: Visualization of transport modes to the university using differently sized icons: car, bike, and pedestrian.

iconMeal.title: Today's Reported Cafeteria Meals in the App
iconMeal.sr_description: This diagram shows the meal choices across the three departments. Instead of bars, icons – a leaf for vegetarian, a fish for fish dishes, and a steak for meat – are displayed in varying sizes. The larger the icon, the more people chose that meal.
iconMeal.altText: Visualization of meal choices with icons for vegetarian, fish, and meat in different sizes.

input.description: Help us measure the ecological footprint of the university by answering this short question:

meal.title: Meal Choice
meal.description: What did you eat in the cafeteria today?
options: I didn’t eat in the cafeteria today

arival.distance: How many kilometers did you travel today?
